pageContext.claim: “I work from early in the morning until late at night, haven't left the White House in many months (except to launch Hospital Ship Comfort) in order to take care of Trade Deals, Military Rebuilding etc., and then I read a phony story in the failing @nytimes about my work schedule and eating habits, written by a third rate reporter who knows nothing about me. I will often be in the Oval Office late into the night & read & see that I am angrily eating a hamberger & Diet Coke in my bedroom. People with me are always stunned. Anything to demean!”
pageContext.analysis: It has been widely reported that Trump has long blocks of unstructured time every day (dubbed "executive time") and that he spends it tweeting or watching TV or working or getting on the phone to talk with friends and advisers or all of the above. Moreover, Trump left the White House on March 10 to meet with Republican lawmakers on Capitol Hill — a month and half not many months before this tweet.
